title: Lead Time for Changes
description: This metric measures the time it takes for a code commit or change to be successfully deployed to production.
interpretations: It reflects the efficiency of your software delivery process.
This measures how quickly teams can deliver changes to users.
High-performing teams typically achieve lead times measured in hours or days.

articles.title: DORA’s software delivery metrics: the four keys.

title: Deployment frequency
description: This metric measures how often application changes are deployed to production.
interpretations: Higher deployment frequency indicates a more efficient and responsive delivery process.
High-performing teams typically deploy multiple times per day.
Lower-performing teams may deploy weekly, monthly, or even less frequently.

articles.title: DORA’s software delivery metrics: the four keys.

title: Change Failure Rate
description: This metric measures the percentage of deployments that cause failures in production, requiring hotfixes or rollbacks.
interpretations: A lower change failure rate indicates a more reliable delivery process.
High-performing teams typically achieve change failure rates below 15%.

articles.title: DORA’s software delivery metrics: the four keys.

title: Mean Time to Recovery (MTTR)
description: This metric measures the time from when an incident is detected until it's resolved and a service is restored.
interpretations: A lower recovery time indicates a more resilient and responsive system.
A lower recovery time indicates a more reliable delivery process.
High-performing teams typically achieve recovery times under an hour.

articles.title: DORA’s software delivery metrics: the four keys.
